meta_description: The Whitney Museum of American Art. Explore works, exhibitions, and events online. Located in New York City.
hours_text:
Photograph by Nic Lehoux

## Tickets

Book tickets online in advance or at the Museum. Members may use their membership cards for anytime admission. Corporate partners and other Museum affiliates may book complimentary tickets. 

Learn about [discounted and free admission](/visit/free-admission), including [Free 25 and Under](/visit/25-and-under), [Free Friday Nights](/visit/free-friday-nights), and [Free Second Sundays](/visit/second-sundays).****

**Adults**  
$30

**Seniors and students**  
$24

**New! 25 and under**  
Free

**Members**   
Free

**Groups**  
[Discounts](/visit/groups) for schools and groups of 10+

[Book Tickets](/admission)[Become a Member](/memberships)

* * *

### The Whitney

The Whitney Museum of American Art is a must-see New York destination. As the preeminent institution devoted to the art of the United States, the Whitney presents the full range of twentieth-century and contemporary American art, with a special focus on works by living artists.

* * *

### Location

Located in Manhattan's Meatpacking District—steps away from the Hudson River Greenway and the West Side Highway—the Whitney is easily accessible by bicycle, car, and public transportation and is a must-see New York destination.

**Address:**  
Whitney Museum of American Art  
99 Gansevoort Street, New York, NY 10014

**Phone:**  
[(212) 570-3600](tel:+12125703600)

[Google Maps](https://maps.app.goo.gl/jtNxB2Ywfep8kxir9) [Apple Maps](https://maps.apple.com/?address=99%20Gansevoort%20St...

accessibility_text:
The Whitney invites visitors to experience the richness and complexity of American art in an inclusive, welcoming environment. Visitors with disabilities receive a discounted rate and admission for one care partner is included for free.

[Book Tickets](/general-admission)

Learn more about [Access Programs for people with disabilities](/education/Access).

Review our [Access Policy for visitors with disabilities](/visit/access/visitors-with-disabilities). 

* * *

## Wheelchair access

**Getting here****  
**Download a map of the area surrounding the Museum, highlighting accessible pathways from public transportation, parking facilities, and the High Line.

[ View map ](https://whitneymedia.org/assets/generic_file/204/UPDATED_Meatpacking_AccessMap_Final_UPDATE3__1_.pdf)

Due to ongoing construction, some streets and sidewalks may not be accessible.

**Access-a-Ride  
** The New York City MTA offers drop-off and pick-up service from the Whitney Museum on the corner of Washington and Gansevoort Street.

**Entrance**  
The accessible path to the Whitney’s main entrance at 99 Gansevoort Street runs from Washington Street along the south side of the building, past the Museum's restaurant on the ground floor. The Rudin Family Entrance at 555 West Street is also accessible.

**Wheelchair availability**  
Manual wheelchairs are available free of charge on a first-come, first-served basis at the admissions desk on Floor 1 or at the coat check.

**Restrooms**

## Winter at the Whitney  
A Seasonal Guide

Come warm up with our favorite ways to celebrate the winter season at the Whitney.

[Read the guide](/visit/winter-at-the-whitney)

* * *

[ ](/visit/free-days-and-nights)

### [Free at the Whitney  
](/visit/free-days-and-nights)

Every Friday evening from 5–10 pm and on the second Sunday of every month, admission to the Museum is free. Both offerings include free access to exhibitions, special programming, city views, and more. Visitors 25 and under are always free, every day. 

[More about free offerings](/visit/free-days-and-nights)

[ ](/exhibitions/the-biennial)
